articles.title: Amazing video shows how squid change colour to camouflage themselves from predators - Daily Mail
articles.description: Researchers from the Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology Graduate University spotted a species of oval squid changing colour to blend in with a background when it sensed a predator.
articles.content:
From chameleons to octopuses, many animals are famous for their use of camouflage to hide from predators.
Now, squid have been caught on camera employing the same techniques for the first time.

articles.title: AB Aurigae b: Hubble Telescope spots Jupiter-like planet forming in an unusual way - BBC
articles.description: The planet is a gas giant, which means it's mostly made up of the gases hydrogen and helium, with swirling gases surrounding a smaller solid core.
articles.content:
Scientists have spotted a giant planet, believed to be about nine times the size of Jupiter, at its early stage of being made.

articles.title: Mars Is Rumbling With Mysterious Quakes We've Never Detected Before - ScienceAlert
articles.description: It turns out that Mars is rumblier than we knew. New techniques have revealed previously undetected quakes beneath the Martian surface – and, scientists say, the best explanation so far is ongoing volcanic activity.

articles.title: ISS photo taken from the ground shows two astronauts performing a spacewalk - Daily Mail
